image.altText: A still from a video appearing to show former SA Liberal leader David Speirs leaning over a plate and snorting.

props.synopsis: David Speirs says he's taking time away from work to concentrate on his health days after a video — which appears to depict him snorting from a plate — emerges. He has previously strenuously denied wrongdoing, reportedly telling News Corp the video is a deepfake.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader takes medical leave two days after 'deepfake' snorting video emerges

image.altText: SA Police generic

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man has died overnight after an alleged stabbing in Adelaide's western suburbs.

title.children: Police investigating alleged murder in Adelaide's western suburbs after stabbing overnight

image.altText: A man wearing glasses flicking through papers looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Ten years on from the chemotherapy underdosing bungle, survivor and advocate Andrew Knox is concerned not enough has changed to protect patients — including SA Health's incident reporting system.

title.children: 'It's just crushing': Chemo underdosing survivor fears error could be repeated

image.altText: Teenage girl wearing glasses and a light brown hoodie looks up from her computer smiling as she plays a video game.

props.synopsis: Both the federal and South Australian governments are proposing legislation to impose a minimum age on social media platforms but details about which services would be affected are scant.

title.children: Calls for online gaming to be banned along with social media for kids under 14

image.altText: A woman with grey hair and a grey jumper sitting on orange seats in a train

props.synopsis: A Mount Gambier woman who spent decades in institutions has found new freedom and joy through public transport — a love she takes to the extreme.

title.children: Why Daphne takes the train to Melbourne only to turn around when she gets there

image.altText: Colourful graphic of a teenage girl sleeping with her head resting on a pile of books behind a laptop.

props.synopsis: Most Australian high schools start the day by 9am but a sleep researcher says pushing the morning bell back later could have some major benefits for teenagers' health.

title.children: Schools encouraged to start later to help 'chronically tired' teens

image.altText: A southern rock lobster

props.synopsis: Rock lobster fishers are growing increasingly frustrated about continuing Chinese government trade restrictions, months after the federal government declared they were on the brink of being lifted.

title.children: Rock lobster industry frustrated after 'battling' four years of China ban

image.altText: A tranquil view of a creek with dead trees mixed with new growth on either side and a bridge in the distance

props.synopsis: Thousands of birds have been seen returning to one of South Australia's most iconic wetlands, which had been on the brink of "severe ecological decline", thanks to human intervention with an environmental water program.

title.children: Chowilla Floodplain bounces back to life as rejuvenating flooding's released from storage

image.altText: Kamala Harris holds up her hand to her chin and squints while looking to the side

props.synopsis: Presidential candidates Donald Trump and Kamala Harris have faced off in a fiery debate in Philadelphia, with Trump clashing repeatedly with the moderators.

title.children: Trump argues with moderators, while Harris defends her values in first debate as candidate

image.altText: A man is silhouetted against a video screen with an Facebook logo as he poses with a smartphone

props.synopsis: Facebook has admitted that it scrapes the public photos, posts and other data of Australian adult users to train its AI models and provides no opt-out option, even though it allows people in the European Union to refuse consent.

title.children: Facebook admits to scraping every Australian adult user's public photos and posts to train AI, with no opt-out option

image.altText: A composite image of Emma Germano and a man in a suit pouring chemical.

props.synopsis: This farmer chose to speak up as peak lobby group closes ranks in the wake of investigations exposing Parkinson's link to chemical.

title.children: Leaked email reveals farming lobby's attempt to silence discussion about Parkinson's link to farming chemical

image.altText: Mother and children together on a brown couch and smile at the camera, with both children leaning into their mother

props.synopsis: Finding the best school for a child can be a daunting decision for parents and one which experts say should be based on the individual learning style of each child.

title.children: Siblings Rufus and Rosie had 'such different needs' – so their parents decided to send them to different schools

image.altText: Terry Buckley holds potatoes at his farm.

props.synopsis: Australian supermarkets have high standards for how a spud should look. Producers say the focus should be on the taste instead.

title.children: Skin-deep beauty standards for Australian potatoes leading to 'absurd' amount of waste

image.altText: A police officer detaining someone

props.synopsis: Capsicum spray has been used by police and protesters have been detained as demonstrations outside the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Center escalate. Follow live.

title.children: Police pepper spray protesters at massive rally against defence expo

image.altText: Small group of protesters near some trees

props.synopsis: A conservation group is lobbying Adelaide councils to save thousands of trees from the axe each year as a petrol station giant's plan to remove two significant river red gums in the inner south is delayed.

title.children: Adelaide's 'abysmal' canopy cover fuels protests against tree lopping

image.altText: Man wearing a suit and glasses, l;ooking dow, walks forward while surrounded by media

props.synopsis: After testimony from 40 family members and survivors detailing how his actions had affected them, bus driver Brett Button has spoken in court about the crash that killed 10 and injured 25 others.

title.children: 'Can't forgive myself': Hunter Valley wedding bus driver tells of shame over deadly crash but denies negligence

image.altText: A man with short hair and a suit walks solemnly near a courthouse

props.synopsis: The MP has been awarded $140,000 after a Federal Court judge found a tweet posted by former One Nation NSW leader Mark Latham was defamatory.

title.children: Sydney MP Alex Greenwich awarded $140,000 after suing Mark Latham

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The judge chairing an inquiry into an English hospital in which infant serial killer Lucy Letby worked tells a hearing anyone doubting the former nurse's guilt is causing her victims' families "enormous additional distress".

title.children: Lucy Letby was convicted of killing seven British babies. A judge has a warning for those who think she's innocent

image.altText: A narrow iron tunnel with an earthern floor and rubbish strewn across it, and a door lying flat in the middle of the image

props.synopsis: The unverified vision shows a cramped and dark tunnel with blood stains on the floor, as well as ammunition and a chess set.

title.children: Israeli military says video shows Gaza tunnel where hostages were killed

image.altText: A white box of illegal Manchester cigarettes in a black bag.

props.synopsis: For the past decade, plain-packaging laws and steep tax increases have helped to reduce the national smoking rate, but a booming black market has led some to question whether the federal government's policy is still working.

title.children: Tobacco retail sales plummeting but not because people have quit smoking

image.altText: Genetic Testing

props.synopsis: Life insurers and those offering income protection and permanent disability insurance will be banned from using genetic testing to refuse cover after a government crackdown.

title.children: Genetic testing to be banned from life insurance, income protection, disability cover

image.altText: A busy pedestrian crossing at the intersection of Spencer and Collins streets in Melbourne's CBD.

props.synopsis: With Australia's economy growing at its slowest pace in decades and expectations interest rates could soon start to fall, analysts are warning there is too much "exuberance" on the share market.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank's share price continues to defy analyst expectations. Here's why

image.altText: A breaker in Australian kit busts a move at the Olympics

props.synopsis: After a performance at the Paris Olympics that sparked global criticism, Australian breaker Raygun is currently ranked number one in the world, sparking the sport's governing body to explain why.

title.children: Raygun is currently ranked the number one breaker in the world, sparking the sport's governing body to explain why

image.altText: A year on from AUKUS and there is no clear plan for nuclear submarines

props.synopsis: The government will agree to make it clear in legislation that Australia will not accept nuclear waste from overseas countries as part of AUKUS. Follow live.

title.children: Australia moves to close AUKUS nuclear waste loophole

image.altText: A woman with brown hair, wearing big earrings and a long puffer coat leans against a wooden post next to a wooden house.

props.synopsis: This community thinks it has found a solution to stop the toxic relationship between teenagers and social media, but is it that simple?

title.children: 'Can't do it on your own': Hundreds of parents make 'phone pledge' to keep teenagers off social media

image.altText: Collage of photos Muriel McKay, the kidnapper (above) and (right) Anna and Rupert Murdoch, 1970

props.synopsis: Media mogul Rupert Murdoch loaned his Rolls Royce to his deputy. It led to a terrible case of mistaken identity that would change the course of two family's lives.

title.children: How the Murdoch family escaped a dark fate after case of mistaken identity

image.altText: An illustration showing a high school girl sitting in class with two boys ridiculing her behind her.

props.synopsis: Image-based abuse is a growing problem among Australian teenagers, but experts and victims say the support on offer for young people needs to be improved.

title.children: Underage girl whose nudes were spread by classmates calls out 'harmful' treatment of victims

image.altText: A woman and man stand against the exterior brick wall of a house.

props.synopsis: The smallest of things would start the abuse, like being asked to take out the bins. It was enough to send Todd into a rage. Not anymore.

title.children: 'Yelling; shouting, intimidation': These men abused their partners. They're now fighting to be better

image.altText: A man sits with his hand on his head.

props.synopsis: Weinstein, 72, is serving a 16-year sentence after being convicted on rape charges by a California court.

title.children: Jailed movie producer Harvey Weinstein 'out of danger' after emergency heart surgery

image.altText: A composite picture of a woman in black-and-white and a man in colour, both looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank governor's prediction that she would hold interest rates for six months was the unlikely trigger for a political war over her institution.

title.children: Bullock's Lowe moment has put an end to the uneasy political truce over the RBA

image.altText: Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, wave farewell before boarding a plane.

props.synopsis: The king and queen will tour Canberra and Sydney as part of a whirlwind trip next month, which will be the first visit of a reigning monarch to Australia in more than a decade.

title.children: BBQs, garden tours, and a parliamentary meet and greet — details of Charles and Camilla's royal visit next month revealed

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are trading fairly flat after a mixed session on Wall Street. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: RBA expects unemployment to keep rising, ASX flat while Wall Street mixed

image.altText: A man pushes a stack of plyboards in flood following a typhoon.

props.synopsis: The death toll in Vietnam from Asia's worst storm this year reaches 141, with torrents of rain triggering floods and landslides, burying homes, sweeping away a bridge and now threatening the capital Hanoi.

title.children: Typhoon Yagi unleashes destruction in Vietnam, kills at least 141

image.altText: Amanda Wright smiling and holding her baby son in a grassy field at goldenhour.

props.synopsis: Most people having cancer treatment won't have a highly produced video released by a PR team to update others on their health. So how do you keep people informed without it becoming a burden?

title.children: Princess Catherine has a media team, but updating others about cancer treatment can be tough
